intro: Rhus chondroloma subsp. huajuapanensis, commonly known as Huajuapan sumac, is a shrub native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes plants known for their toxic sap and edible fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are compound, with serrated margins, and it produces small, aggregate fruits that are red when mature. The species is of interest for its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
